required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Possible Relationship Between Periodontal Disease and Preterm Labor
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Possible Relationship Between Preterm Labor and Periodontal Disease With Clinical Periodontal, Biochemical and Microbiological Data

lead_sponsor.agency: Recep Tayyip Erdogan University Training and Research Hospital

clinical_study.source: Recep Tayyip Erdogan University Training and Research Hospital

brief_summary.textblock:
The primary objective of the study is to assess the incidence and severity of the periodontal infection of patients with preterm labor.
The secondary objective of the study is to analyze the relationship between preterm labor and periodontal infection, using clinical, biochemical and microbiological methods.

detailed_description.textblock: Preterm infants are born prior to completion of 37 weeks of gestation. Periodontal disease is a subclinical and persistent infection source which induces the systemic inflammatory reactions and increases the risk of preterm labor. It is believed that the results will set light to the etiology of preterm labor and will help to develop strategies to prevent the disease.

primary_outcome.description: prostaglandin E2 levels will be evaluated in salivary, serum and placenta samples using ELISA test Normal value:29-97 pg / ml
TNF-Alpha levels will be evaluated in salivary, serum and placenta samples using ELISA test Normal value:42-203pg/ml
IL-1beta levels will be evaluated in salivary, serum and placenta samples using ELISA test Normal value:3-227pg/ml

secondary_outcome.description: Presence of Porphyromonas gingivalis will be checked by rPCR method. Score 1: Present Score 2: None
Presence of Tannerella Forsythia will be checked by rPCR method. Score:1 Present. Score 2: None

arm_group.description: Workgroup consists of patients which diagnosed with preterm labor between the age of 21 and 34
24-36 6/7 weeks of pregnant between the age of 21 and 34

intervention.description: liver function tests, kidney function tests and platelets measures the ratio of protein to creatinine
liver function tests, kidney function tests and platelets measures the ratio of protein to creatinine

biospec_descr.textblock: Tissue samples from four centers will be taken from the maternal and fetal surfaces of the placenta Saliva samples of pregnant women

study_pop.textblock: The study is planned to be a case-control study. Workgroup consists of 50 patients which diagnosed with preterm labor between the age of 21 and 34. Control group consists of healthy females 24-36 6/7 weeks of pregnant with no history of preterm labor.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- pregnant women with preterm labor
- 37. weeks of pregnant women with no history of preterm labor
Exclusion Criteria:
- Genitourinary infection
- pregnancy or pre-pregnancy hypertension
- HIV infection
- diabetes mellitus
- multiple pregnancy, preterm labor / low birth weight
- smoker and alcohol use history
- IVF pregnancy
- placental, cervical and uterine anomalies
- pregnancy with intrauterine growth retardation
- pregnancies with congenital or chromosomal fetal anomalies
- significant vaginal bleeding
- infertility stories
- drug addicts
- poor socioeconomic level

facility.name: İzmir Health Sciences University, Tepecik Training and Research Hospital Department of Obstetrics and Gynecology
Recep Tayyip Erdogan University Dentistry Faculty
Recep Tayyip Erdogan University Faculty of Medicine
Glaskow Dental School , School of Medicine University of Glasgow

link.description: Association of periodontitis with preterm birth and low birth weight

reference.citation: Puertas A, Magan-Fernandez A, Blanc V, Revelles L, O'Valle F, Pozo E, León R, Mesa F. Association of periodontitis with preterm birth and low birth weight: a comprehensive review. J Matern Fetal Neonatal Med. 2018 Mar;31(5):597-602. doi: 10.1080/14767058.2017.1293023. Epub 2017 Feb 28. Review.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Recep Tayyip Erdogan University Training and Research Hospital

patient_data.ipd_description: Data will be available within 6 months of study completion
